cnss.simulator

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • cnss.simulator.Link

  • public class Link
extends java.lang.Object
    A Link class that represents a link between two nodes. It contains four packet queues, and in bound and out bound queue for each side of the link. Sides of the link are noted side 1 and side 2. It also helps with the simulation the transmission of packets from one side to the other side.
    Version:
    1.0, September 2020
    Author:
    System's team of the Department of Informatics of FCT/UNL based on a, preliminary version by Adam Greenhalgh of UCL

      • transmitPackets

        public void transmitPackets(int now)
        If the link is up, moves packets from the out queue of one end to the in queue of the other end by creating DELIVER events of the packets associated with the other side of the link
        Parameters:
        now - is the current time

      • getOutputEvent

        public Event getOutputEvent()
        Return an output Event generated by the transmission of packets to be later treated by the main loop of the simulator
        Returns:
        Event, the event

      • enqueuePacket

        public void enqueuePacket(int nodeid,
                          Packet p)
        Places the Packet p, in the out bound queue for the node specified by node id. Increments output counters.
        Parameters:
        nodeid - the router whose out bound queue to place the packet in.
        p - the packet being sent.

      • queueLength

        public int queueLength(int side,
                       boolean inbound)
        Returns the queue length for a particular direction and side of the link.
        Parameters:
        side - with values 1 or 2 specifies the side.
        inbound - specifies whether the in queue or out queue.
        Returns:
        the length of the queue
